meanings.definition: Lacking experience or sophistication; innocent or unsophisticated.
meanings.sent1: She was so naiver that she believed everything she was told.
meanings.sent2: The naiver child trusted strangers without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: His naiver approach to the situation made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: In a world of deceit, her naiver nature was like a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The naiver look in her eyes revealed her innocence.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of experience, wisdom, or judgment.
meanings.sent1: His naiver actions led to unintended consequences.
meanings.sent2: The naiver decision proved to be a costly mistake.
meanings.sent3: Despite his naiver choices, he always learned from them.
meanings.sent4: The naiver behavior stood out among the more cautious group.
meanings.sent5: Her naiver words showed her lack of understanding.

meanings.definition: To be naive or lacking in experience.
meanings.sent1: She tends to naiver when faced with new challenges.
meanings.sent2: I often naiver when it comes to technology.
meanings.sent3: He will naiver until he gains more knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Don't naiver too much; sometimes you need to take risks.
meanings.sent5: Learning to naiver is part of growing up.
